DataElement.preferredName: No Prior Prostate Gland Therapy Surgical Procedure Radiation Therapy Treatment Regimen Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether there was no previous treatment for prostate cancer, including surgery and radiation therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: No Prior Prostate Gland Therapy Surgical Procedure Radiation Therapy Treatment Regimen
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the absence of prior (earlier in time or order) prostate gland (a gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder) therapy, including surgery (operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of disease) and radiation therapy (the use of high-energy radiation from x-rays, gamma rays, neutrons, and other sources to kill cancer cells and shrink tumors).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:Earlier in time or order.:A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Radiation Therapy Treatment Regimen
Property.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

Concepts.definition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
